This bill would change the Fair Labor Standards Act to exclude the  value of these services from the regular rate used to calculate  overtime.

Despite its name, the bill does not require employers to provide any  child or elder care. Instead, it just reduces the cost of overtime if  they provide it.…

This bill would exclude child and dependent care from the  rate of pay used to calculate a worker's overtime pay. In other words,  this bill makes it permissible to pay workers less than their regular  rate if they picked up an extra shift.
